title: DC-ControlNet: Decoupling Inter- and Intra-Element Conditions in Image Generation with Diffusion Models
author: Hongji Yang (University of Macau), Wencheng Han (University of Macau), Yucheng Zhou (University of Macau), Jianbing Shen (University of Macau)
background: This paper presents a method for generating images using diffusion models that can independently control various aspects of image elements, allowing for more precise image creation.
contribution: DC-ControlNet introduces decoupling of control conditions in image generation to solve limitations of previous models, achieving greater flexibility and accuracy in multi-condition image generation.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like ControlNet relied on global conditions that affected the entire image, limiting customizable control of individual elements.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by allowing independent control over content and layout for each image element, enhancing the model's ability to manage overlapping regions and occlusions.

key_innovation: By decoupling global control into hierarchical systems of individual conditions, users can manipulate each element's content and layout distinctly.
real_world_impact: The framework potentially allows for greater creativity in applications like video game art and product design, where precise image manipulation is essential.

new_terms.Intra-Element Controller: **Intra-Element Controller** is a module in the proposed framework that manages various control signals (like color and texture) for individual elements in the generated image.
new_terms.Inter-Element Controller: **Inter-Element Controller** refers to a component that manages the relationships between different elements in the image, including their occlusions and spatial interactions.

open_sourcing: The dataset, DMC-120k, will be made publicly available.
